citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A quail in the night house of the aviary was observed with feather loss on the back of the head and in a strip
approximately 2cm wide over the back of the bird from the head to just above the tail. The keeper stated the feather loss
had been going on for 2-4 weeks and they had not contacted their attending veterinarian but would discuss it at the next
visit by the veterinarian scheduled for later this week. The inspector spoke to the attending veterinarian who stated the
facility should be contacting her in a timely basis about health issues in the birds.
Feather loss can be due to trauma, infection, or systemic causes and can cause discomfort or distress to the birds.
Facilities must have a mechanism of direct and frequent communication so that timely and accurate information on
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Correct by: December 20, 2024

On October 31 and November 9, 2024, guests were observed accidentally stepping on parakeets in the aviary. The birds
died and necropsy showed signs consistent with trauma. The aviary is a walk-through exhibit with an attendant that allows
feeding of seed sticks to the birds by guests.
Failure to ensure careful handling can result in trauma and/or death to the birds in the exhibit.
Handling of all animals must be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma or physical harm.
Correct from December 18, 2024 forward
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
